snippet: At a time of painful austerity in Spain, corruption charges against figures like the former small-town mayor María Victoria Pinilla are stoking bitter resentment.
abstract: Corruption charges against Spanish officials at all levels of government, coming at a time of painful austerity in Spain, are stoking bitter resentment; European economic crisis has helped lift veil on corrupt officials across continent, and although Spain is by no means Europe's most corrupt nation, sheer volume of country's political corruption cases is undermining credibility of government and proving deeply embarrassing.
lead_paragraph: At a time of painful austerity in Spain, corruption charges against figures like the former small-town mayor María Victoria Pinilla are stoking bitter resentment.

headline.seo: In Lean Years After Boom, Spain’s Graft Laid Bare
headline.main: Small-Town Mayor’s Millions as Exhibit A on Graft in Spain
headline.print_headline: Small-Town Mayor’s Millions As Exhibit A on Graft in Spain
